result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt:
1:53 PM - case called.  Defendant Benjamin James Asmundsen appeared by video, in custody from the Lincoln County Jail.  Attorney Erich Scherr in court, specially.  Attorney Andrew R Polzin in court for State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Polzin regarding victim rights.  Court questions if there are any victims appearing that wish to be heard - no response.  In receipt of complaint - waive reading - right to counsel.  Court enters not guilty plea on behalf of Defendant.  Argument by State as to bond.  Courts sets bond.  Atty Scherr waives time limits for scheduling the preliminary hearing.  Court accepts waiver of time limits.
Scheduling conference scheduled for October 20, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Scheduling conference on October 20, 2022 at 11:00 am.
